channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden Administration Proposes Ban on Chinese Software in Vehicles
item.description: Federal officials acknowledged that few Chinese vehicles were on U.S. roads now, but said that the administration wanted to take proactive measures to...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel and Hezbollah Trade Heavy Fire; Over 180 Killed in Lebanon, Officials Say
item.description: More than 700 others were injured by Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon, officials there said. Sirens went off in northern Israel as the armed group ...

item.title: Software, news, and environmental CEOs reveal how they’re using AI to transform their businesses
item.description: As emerging technologies like generative AI advance quickly, companies across all sectors are rethinking how to maintain an edge.

item.title: Suspect in Trump Assassination Attempt Outlined Plans in Note
item.description: The disclosure, included in a court filing, paints the clearest picture yet of an itinerant contractor who repeatedly said he was willing to die to de...

item.title: Russian Military Plane Breaches Japan’s Airspace
item.description: The infringements were the first by Russia in five years, according to the Japanese defense ministry. A fighter fired a warning flare in response.

item.title: Global health leaders pen open letter to ‘those with the power to prevent lives being lost to the climate crisis’
item.description: There is simply not enough money being invested to help communities and local healthcare systems adapt to the health threats of climate change.

item.title: Sean Combs’s Arrest Has the Music World Asking: Is Our #MeToo Here?
item.description: Activists and survivors are hopeful for change after the industry, which has a pervasive party culture, largely avoided the accountability that swept ...

item.title: Extensive Israeli Strikes on Lebanon Kill Scores
item.description: Israeli warplanes struck at least 300 sites across Lebanon on Monday. The airstrikes were targeting the militant group Hezbollah, which fired dozens o...

item.title: Jamie Dimon is bothered by federal employees not working in their D.C. offices 5 days a week
item.description: JPMorgan’s CEO Jamie Dimon is not a fan of hybrid working—so much so, that he’s even taking issue with the few days D.C. federal employees work from h...

item.title: Defense Lawyers Scramble to Halt Marcellus Williams’s Execution in Missouri
item.description: A hearing on Monday in the state’s Supreme Court could determine whether Marcellus Williams is executed on Tuesday for a 1998 murder conviction.

item.title: Man Smashes Ai Weiwei’s Porcelain Sculpture at Italian Museum
item.description: The man behind the episode, at a reception for Mr. Ai’s new exhibition in Bologna, has targeted artists before, a museum spokesman said.

item.title: Harris has been outspending Trump by $5 million a day since recent donation surge
item.description: Harris has continued to ramp up spending. She’s spending $152 million on advertising in September, more than double the $63 million Trump is spending.

item.title: Global Threats
item.description: We explore a report that details the threats faced by the U.S.

item.title: As Soccer Jerseys Become Vintage Streetwear, Big Investors Buy In
item.description: Vintage soccer jerseys have become a streetwear staple, and a target of major investors. Their real appeal lies in the memories they conjure.

item.title: Turkey wants to protect döner kebabs as its own. But Germany’s $2.6 billion kebab industry has a bone to pick with it
